name: WASP-43
scenarioDescription:
The WASP-43 Exoplanetary System


Overview

WASP-43 is a star with 0.58 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.6 times its radius. It is located 260.92 light years away from the solar system.

WASP-43 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the WASP-43 system


WASP-43 b

WASP-43 b was discovered by the SuperWASP observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.01 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of WASP-43 b is 566.04 times the mass of Earth. The radius of WASP-43 b is 10.424 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, WASP-43 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system WASP-43, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by SuperWASP.
